name: Abundance conjecture
rephrased: If a projective variety with Kawamata log terminal singularities has a nef canonical bundle, then some sufficiently large multiple of that bundle is base-point free.
implication_form: If a projective variety X with Kawamata log terminal singularities has a nef canonical bundle, then the canonical bundle is semi-ample.
solved_by: No one fully solved it yet, but Caucher Birkar has established important cases
explained: The Abundance Conjecture is a central problem in algebraic geometry that states if a projective variety has a nef (numerically) canonical bundle, then it must be semi-ample. In simpler terms, it predicts that a certain type of geometric object with a "good" canonical bundle will have a "good" model with specific properties, meaning the canonical bundle will be generated by a global section and behave nicely. Proving this conjecture is a major goal in the minimal model program, and important cases have been proven.
